context_of_use: This use case allows customers to track their order status and managers to review and approve orders within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to track order status
manager: wants to approve orders to avoid delays
description: This use case enables customers to track their orders and allows managers to approve those orders.
triggering_event: Customer or manager initiates order tracking or approval.
preconditions: Manager has access to the order management system.
postconditions: Customer can view the current status of their order.
assumptions: Customers have accounts to track their orders.
Managers have the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific order statuses that can be tracked.
main_flow: 1. Customer requests to track their order → System displays current order status.
2. Manager reviews pending orders → System presents order details for approval.
3. Manager approves the order → System updates order status to approved.
